have you ever tried writing a song in the locrian mode

what happens when you try to base a song in locrian: it almost immediately tends to shift into neighboring relative normal modes. for example, if you start writing something in C locrian, it's going to have a tendency to start sounding like Bb minor, or maybe even Db major, or perhaps Ab mixolydian, etc... I think you'll find it will be an uphill battle to continue to 'prove' that C is actually the root of it

I want to make songs in the future but I dont know where to start, I don't even know all the keys in piano, it's hard to start something that I don't know where to start of. How can you come up of making songs?

i'm not sure. i discovered most of the music basics when i was a very small child. but doing 'songs' still required a lot of additional spiritual exploration (or at least i chose to require that of myself), but i had a lot of musical experience to back it up. i'm not sure what it would be like to approach it without having that musical experience, but, in some ways i suspect it might have been simpler and more adventurous, with less blockages maybe. i've had to do a lot of soul-searching at some points, to coax the adventures out. but if i had no musical experience i suspect that the adventures might have been ready to go, right on the surface. i think i've seen other people work this way

what should one do if they're seen as awkward? I'm often told that I come off as a rude and arrogant person even when I don't intend to because I'm blunt and also slightly clueless about social norms. I'm sick of people's expectations but people in general are not willing to help you unless you're conforming? it's so hard to find a balance between being yourself and being what others expect you to be. I used to seek a lot of validation from others before, but now I'm slightly more self-confident. However, a few people have asked me if I'm depressed or something and try to figure out what's "wrong" with me (and they try to be subtle about it), and I just get the general feeling that people don't like being in my presence because I'm too uncomfortable or stand-offish. Although I've learned not to mind it too much, I feel this is only going to alienate me further from others and prevent me from getting things done. idk I'm just venting here, sorry

i'd say take all the energy you just spent regarding what other people think of you, and put it toward being who you actually think you should be. after a few years of some genuine devotion, you'll probably turn out to be a superstar
